subject: Home & DIY
title: The Well That Built Civilization
description: One-minute skill: The Well That Built Civilization.

hook.text: The oldest known well is 8,000 years old, found in Cyprus. Before wells, humans could only live near rivers and springs.

buildup.text: A well taps the water tableâ€”where soil is saturated underground. Suddenly, settlements could exist anywhere above it.

discovery.text: Wells freed humanity from rivers. Villages formed around wells in arid plains where farming was impossible before.

twist.text: Shared wells built communities but sparked conflicts. Water rights wars rank among humanity's oldest disputes.

climax.text: Modern drilled wells reach 300+ meters. The average US well supplies 300 gallons per day for one household.

punchline.text: One hole in the ground changed where humanity could live.

quiz.question: How did the invention of wells change human settlement patterns?
options: People could settle anywhere above the water table, not just near rivers
Wells allowed the first irrigation of desert farmland
Wells prevented flooding by draining excess surface water
